address: 4571 Steveston Highway, 4591 Steveston Highway, 4611/4631 Steveston Highway
description: Jonathan King has applied to develop 16 townhouse units at 4571, 4591, and 4611/4631 Steveston Highway. The site is being rezoned from 'Single Detached (RSl/E)' and 'Two-Unit Dwellings (RDl)' zones to the 'Low Density Townhouses (RTL4)' zone for this project under Bylaw 10081 (RZ 18-839945). A Servicing Agreement is required as a condition of Building Permit issuance. The proposed scheme has satisfactorily addressed urban design issues and complies with the Official Community Plan (OCP) and the 'Low Density Townhouse (RTL4)', except for the zoning variance to reduce the front yard setback along Steveston Highway from 6.0 m to 4.50 m. The building height is stepped down to two-storeys along the east property line to provide an appropriate transition to the adjacent single-family home. Along the west property line, an entry driveway is being proposed and the three-storey building will be set back 9.42 m from the west property line. Two-storey units in duplex form, as well as the outdoor amenity area, are proposed along the rear (north) property line to minimize privacy and overlook concerns.

rawSummaries.summary:
DP 20-919145 - 4571, 4591, and 4611/4631 Steveston Highway
Jonathan King has applied to the City of Richmond for permission to develop 16 townhouse units at 4571, 4591, and 4611/4631 Steveston Highway. The site is being rezoned from 'Single Detached (RSl/E)' and 'Two-Unit Dwellings (RDl)' zones to the 'Low Density Townhouses (RTL4)' zone for this project under Bylaw 10081 (RZ 18-839945). A Servicing Agreement is required as a condition of Building Permit issuance. The Public Hearing for the rezoning of this site was held on October 21, 2019, with no concerns expressed. The proposed scheme has satisfactorily addressed the significant urban design issues and other staff comments. The applicant requests to vary the provisions of Richmond Zoning Bylaw 8500 to reduce the front yard setback along Steveston Highway from 6.0 m to 4.50 m, which is supported by staff. The Advisory Design Panel has reviewed the project and supports it. The proposed form, massing, and orientation of the buildings are compatible with the existing adjacent developments on the block.

description: Karla Castellanos Architect has applied for a Development Permit at 13888 Wireless Way to construct a three-storey light industrial and ancillary office building of approximately 3,748 m2 (40,353 ft2) containing 11 strata-titled units on a new lot (Lot 1) created through subdivision on the west portion of the subject site. The proposal aligns with the City's objectives of intensifying existing industrial lands. The existing office building is to remain on a new lot on the east portion of the subject site (Lot 2). The proposal also involves landscaped restoration within the existing Riparian Management Area (RMA) along the south side of the existing site, as well as improvements to pedestrian circulation and landscaping within the surface parking area on Lot 2. The site is zoned 'Industrial Business Park (ZI3) - Crestwood Area (East Cambie)'. The Applicant has proposed Transportation Demand Management (TDM) measures to support the requested variance in parking requirements, including an employee shuttle service between the subject site and the Bridgeport Canada Line station during peak hours, and a subsidized monthly transit pass program to Lot 1 employees, which will run for three years.

description: Rezoning from RF to CD (based on RM-70) and Development Permit for 15473, 15485 and 15495 - 16A Avenue. The permit is for the development of a six-storey apartment building consisting of 66 units. The council has endorsed the Public Notification to proceed for Bylaw No. 21135 to rezone the subject site from 'Single Family Residential Zone (RF)' to 'Comprehensive Development Zone (CD)' (based on 'Multiple Residential 70 Zone (RM-70)'). The council has also authorized staff to draft Development Permit No. 7923-0144-00, generally in accordance with the attached drawings (Appendix I). description: The Development Permit No. 7922-0170-00 is for the property located at 12090 - 104 Avenue. The applicant, 1046089 B.C. Ltd., is seeking an NCP Amendment from 'Parks and Open Spaces' to 'Highway Commercial' for a portion of the site. The development also includes a Development Variance Permit to allow the construction of a 7,390.24 square metre industrial building. The permit was authorized by the Council and includes a resolution to amend the South Westminster Neighbourhood Concept Plan (NCP) to partially redesignate the land from 'Parks and Open Spaces' to 'Highway Commercial' when the project is considered for final adoption.

rawSummaries.summary:
7922-0170-00
NCP Amendment from 'Parks and Open Spaces' to 'Highway Commercial' for a portion of the site. Development Permit / Development Variance Permit to permit the construction of a 7,390.24 square metre industrial building. Address: 12090 - 104 Avenue. Owner: 1046089 B.C. Ltd. Director Information: S. Bains. Officer Information as at August 17, 2022: S. Bains (President). Agent: Architecture Panel Inc. (Ruchir Dhall). Council authorized staff to draft Development Permit No. 7922-0170-00 generally in accordance with the attached drawings (Appendix I), and the finalized Ecosystem Development Plan and Geotechnical Report. Council approved Development Variance Permit No. 7922-0170-00, to reduce the minimum setback distance from top of bank of a Class A (red-coded) channelized stream from 25 metres to 15 metres, on the north side of the stream (Manson Canal), to proceed to Public Notification. Council instructed staff to resolve various issues prior to final approval, including engineering requirements, urban design issues, landscaping plan, tree survey, Ecosystem Development Plan, Impact Mitigation Plan, Geotechnical Report, demolition of existing buildings and structures, and registration of a Section 219 Restrictive Covenant to restrict the maximum amount of mezzanine space permitted on-site given the parking allocation. Council to pass a resolution to amend the South Westminster Neighbourhood Concept Plan (NCP) to partially redesignate the land from 'Parks and Open Spaces' to 'Highway Commercial' when the project is considered for final adoption (Appendix IV).

description: The application is for an NCP Amendment from 'Low Density Cluster' to 'Medium Density Cluster', rezoning from A-1 to CD (based on RM-30), and a development permit to permit the development of 74 townhouses. Several issues need to be resolved prior to final adoption, including engineering requirements, urban design issues, landscaping plans, tree preservation, density bonus amenity contribution, and more. A resolution to amend the West Clayton Neighbourhood Concept Plan (NCP) to redesignate the land from 'Low Density Cluster' to 'Medium Density Cluster' is also required when the project is considered for final adoption.

description: Anthony Boni has applied for a Development Permit for the construction of a three-storey 25-unit affordable rental housing building at 4831 Steveston Highway. The site is being rezoned from 'Single Detached (RS 1/E)' to 'Low Rise Rental Apartments (ZLR48) - Steveston Highway (Steveston)' under Bylaw 10478 (RZ 23-018081). The proposed project has funding support from the Canada Mortgage and Housing Corporation (CMHC) and BC Housing in partnership with Turning Point Housing Society. Design issues identified during the rezoning process include compliance with Development Permit Guidelines, enhancing residential streetscape, refining the site plan for aboveground private utility infrastructure improvements, landscaping and tree management, common amenity space programming and design, accessibility, pedestrian circulation, sustainability, crime prevention through environmental design, parking, loading, waste management, and off-site frontage elements. Concerns expressed during the Public Hearing include direct connection to the Railway Greenway and providing more bicycle parking opportunities for residents. Staff have worked with the applicant to ensure the proposed architectural form and character align with design guidelines and interface well with adjacent properties. A Servicing Agreement is required for the building permit issuance.

rawSummaries.summary:

The proposed project has funding support from the Canada Mortgage and Housing Corporation (CMHC) and BC Housing in partnership with Turning Point Housing Society. The staff recommends issuing the Development Permit and allowing 37% of the required vehicle parking spaces to be small car spaces. Concerns expressed during the Public Hearing include direct connection to the Railway Greenway and providing more bicycle parking opportunities for residents. A Servicing Agreement is required for the building permit issuance.

description: Rezoning and development permit for the property located at 12538 Old Yale Road. The owner of the property is Ruskin Enterprises Ltd, with H. Sidhu as the director. The agent for the development is Mainland Engineering Consultants Corporation, represented by Avnash Banwait. The proposed development includes a NCP Amendment from 'Parks and Open Spaces' to 'Urban Residential', as well as a rezoning from RF to RF-13. Additionally, a Development Permit for Hazard Lands (Steep Slope) and a Development Variance Permit to allow subdivision into 2 single family small lots are requested. The Council has approved the rezoning and Development Variance Permit No. 7922-0352-00, with specific variations to proceed to Public Notification. Prior to final adoption, the Council has instructed staff to resolve various issues including engineering requirements, tree preservation, affordable housing strategy, and noise mitigation measures. Furthermore, the Council has passed a resolution to amend the South Westminster Neighbourhood Concept Plan to redesignate the subject site from 'Parks and Open Spaces' to 'Urban Residential' when the project is considered for final adoption.

rawSummaries.summary:
7922-0352-00
12538 Old Yale Road - RF to RF-13 – to subdivide into 2 single family small lots. Council authorized staff to draft a Hazard Lands Development Permit No. 7922-0352-00 generally in accordance with the subdivision layout (Appendix I), and the geotechnical report.

7922-0352-00
Rezoning from RF to RF-13 and Development Permit for Hazard Lands (Steep Slope) / Development Variance Permit for 12538 Old Yale Road. The permit includes a Bylaw to rezone the subject site from 'Single Family Residential Zone (RF)' to 'Single Family Residential (13) Zone (RF-13)' and a date to be set for Public Hearing. It also involves a Development Variance Permit No. 7922-0352-00, varying several setbacks and lot depth requirements for proposed Lot 1. description: The application is for a General Compliance Ruling for the construction of 30 townhouse units at 7580 No. 1 Road. The rezoning of the site to the 'Medium Density Townhouse (RTM2)' zone was approved by Council on October 12, 2021. The proposed modification to the Tree Management Plan and Landscape Plan is to address the deterioration and irreversible decline of a tree (Tree Tag #726) that was supposed to be retained. The south side yard setback at the southwest corner of the site was increased to 7.56 m to retain the Sycamore maple tree (Tree 726). The applicant agreed to plant 62 new trees on-site, including 13 conifers and 49 deciduous trees. Tree 726 has shown signs of decline since June 2022 and is in an advanced state of irreversible decline, according to the Project Arborist's findings. The City's Tree Preservation staff have reviewed and agreed with these findings.

rawSummaries.summary:

1132865 BC Ltd. has requested a General Compliance ruling to modify the Tree Management Plan and Landscape Plan for the construction of 30 townhouse units at 7580 No. 1 Road. The rezoning of the site to the 'Medium Density Townhouse (RTM2)' zone was approved by Council on October 12, 2021. The Development Permit (DP 18-829236) was also issued on October 12, 2021. The proposed modification to the Tree Management Plan and Landscape Plan is to address the deterioration and irreversible decline of a tree (Tree Tag #726) that was supposed to be retained. The proposed changes do not impact any works associated with the Servicing Agreement. Ten trees were identified to be retained and protected, with this report specifically addressing Tree 726. The south side yard setback at the southwest corner of the site was increased to 7.56 m to retain the Sycamore maple tree (Tree 726). Tree protection fencing was installed around all retained trees prior to construction activities. A Tree Management Plan and Landscape Plan were issued with the Development Permit. The applicant agreed to plant 62 new trees on-site, including 13 conifers and 49 deciduous trees. Tree 726 has shown signs of decline since June 2022 and is in an advanced state of irreversible decline, according to the Project Arborist's findings. The City's Tree Preservation staff have reviewed and agreed with these findings.

description: The Development Permit at 11191 Twigg Place is for the installation of a barge loading facility on an Environmentally Sensitive Area (ESA) site. The site is currently zoned as 'Industrial (I)' and is used for truck and industrial equipment storage. The proposed barge ramp would be located within the ESA portion of the site. The owner plans to construct a barge ramp in the water lot in front of the site for transporting aggregate materials. No aggregate materials would be stored on-site. The water lot is currently leased and used for log storage. Access to the ramp would be provided via a truck staging area and a drive aisle on the site. The development would not include any additional buildings or structures beyond the barge ramp. The existing office operation in the shipping containers would remain. The site would be raised to prepare for future dike improvements and climate change effects, with lock block walls installed along the property lines. Truck traffic would access the barges via the raised surface. The proposed barge ramp facility requires approvals from multiple regulatory agencies in addition to the City of Richmond.

description: Lovick Scott Architects has applied for permission to undertake exterior building renovations to the existing McDonald's restaurant located at #115 10700 Cambie Road. This includes upgrades to the on-site landscaping and the existing garbage and recycling enclosure on a site zoned 'Auto-Oriented Commercial (CA)'. The proposed modifications will only be made to the McDonald's restaurant and not the neighboring commercial retail unit. The site is part of a commercial complex with other businesses and off-street parking. The proposed scheme satisfactorily addresses urban design issues and staff comments. It complies with the Official Community Plan and the 'Auto-Oriented Commercial (CA)' zone. The modifications are primarily limited to the building exterior, existing landscape areas, and service area. Off-street parking, vehicle circulation, and drive-through servicing will generally remain unchanged. Additional modifications include parking stall curb stops, pavement markings, maintaining pedestrian linkage, and implementing additional signage. The drive-through configuration will be maintained. The surrounding off-street parking provides for 25 vehicle parking stalls, complying with requirements.

The site is part of a commercial complex with other businesses and off-street parking. The proposed scheme satisfactorily addresses urban design issues and staff comments. It complies with the Official Community Plan and the 'Auto-Oriented Commercial (CA)' zone. Due to the minor nature of the renovations, the application was not presented to the Advisory Design Panel. Conditions of Adjacency include modifications to the on-site enclosure for garbage, recycling, and organic waste, screening of existing rooftop mechanical units, and orientation of drive-through operations audio/speaker box system to minimize impacts. The modifications are primarily limited to the building exterior, existing landscape areas, and service area. The drive-through configuration will be maintained, and the surrounding off-street parking provides for 25 vehicle parking stalls, complying with requirements.

address: 12700 Rice Mill Road, 12800 Rice Mill Road, 12280 No. 5 Road, 12300 No. 5 Road
description: The Development Permit is for the redevelopment of the BC Ferries Fleet Maintenance Unit and future subdivision at 12700 and 12800 Rice Mill Road and 12280 and 12300 No. 5 Road. The site is being rezoned from Agricultural (AGl) and Light Industrial (IL) to BC Ferries Fleet Maintenance and Moorage (ZI 14) to allow for the upgrading of the BC Ferries FMU. The Development Permit application includes habitat compensation and mitigation measures for the designated Environmentally Sensitive Areas and Riparian Management Areas on the site. The scope of the FMU redevelopment includes construction of a new machine shop building, renovations, modifications, additions to existing buildings, addition of off-street parking, loading, and bike parking provisions, grade and elevation increases across the site, demolition of existing buildings, and compensation and enhancements to the Environmentally Sensitive Areas and Riparian Management Areas. The revised scope of FMU redevelopment involves retrofitting and modifying existing buildings to accommodate FMU activities. Surrounding development includes vacant lands zoned Agriculture (AGl) to the north and a model airplane park also zoned Agriculture (AGl). There is a designated Riparian Management Area associated with an existing watercourse along Rice Mill Road.

rawSummaries.summary:
DP 18-824566 - 12700 and 12800 Rice Mill Road and 12280 and 12300 No. 5 Road
Staff Recommendation: Issue a Development Permit for the redevelopment of the BC Ferries Fleet Maintenance Unit and future subdivision at 12700 and 12800 Rice Mill Road and 12280 and 12300 No. 5 Road, which is designated as an Environmentally Sensitive Area. Project Description: - SNC Lavalin Inc., on behalf of BC Ferry Services Inc., has applied for a Development Permit for the redevelopment of the BC Ferries Fleet Maintenance Unit and related components at the specified locations. - The site is being rezoned from Agricultural (AGl) and Light Industrial (IL) to BC Ferries Fleet Maintenance and Moorage (ZI 14) to allow for the upgrading of the BC Ferries FMU. - The Development Permit application includes habitat compensation and mitigation measures for the designated Environmentally Sensitive Areas and Riparian Management Areas on the site. - A Servicing Agreement is required for infrastructure upgrades and dike works. Summary of FMU Works and Improvements: - Construction of a new machine shop building and supporting uses at the southeast portion of the site. - Renovations, modifications, and additions to existing buildings. - Addition of off-street parking, loading, and bike parking provisions. - Grade and elevation increases across the site. - Demolition of existing buildings at the southeast portion of the site. - Compensation and enhancements to the Environmentally Sensitive Areas and Riparian Management Areas. Revised Scope of FMU Redevelopment: - Two new buildings and a tower crane are not being constructed at this time. - Existing buildings will be retrofitted and modified to accommodate FMU activities. Background: - Surrounding development includes vacant lands zoned Agriculture (AGl) to the north and a model airplane park also zoned Agriculture (AGl). - There is a designated Riparian Management Area associated with an existing watercourse along Rice Mill Road.

description: The development permit DP 22-013200 at 6011 River Road, Richmond, BC includes the following features: variance to permit up to 35 bicycle lockers in each bicycle storage room, 2 car share parking spaces with 24/7 public access, bicycle maintenance facilities, minimum 24% EV visitor parking spaces, charging outlets for minimum 10% of class 1 bicycle storage, and other TDMs as per legal agreements. The project proposes to provide 40 dwelling units (+11% of the total unit count) that are designed to incorporate all of the Basic Universal Housing (BUH) Features as described in Section 4.16 of the Richmond Zoning Bylaw 8500. The development also includes aging in place features in all units, balcony encroachment into SRW, maximum 7-storey building height permitted, urban agriculture area on podium, irrigation automatic system for all planted areas, PROPSRW registered on title, tree protection required for City trees, and servicing agreement required for off-site works and works in PROPSRW.

rawSummaries.summary:
DP 22-013200
DP 22-013200 6011 RIVER ROAD, RICHMOND, BC
Original Date: 05/31/22
Revision Date 06/01/22
- Variance to permit up to 35 bicycle lockers (e.g. 70 class 1 bicycle parking spaces) in each bicycle storage room
- 2 car share parking spaces with SRW requiring 24/7 public access, bicycle maintenance facilities, min. 24% EV visitor parking spaces, charging outlets for min. 10% of class 1 bicycle storage and other TDMs as per legal agreements
- 40 BUH units required to comply with section 4.16 of Richmond Zoning Bylaw 8500
- Aging in place features to be provided in all units, including stairwell handrails, lever-type handles for doors and plumbing fixtures, and solid wall blocking in washrooms at all toilets, bathtubs and showers to facilitate future grab bar installation.
- Balcony Encroachment into SRW: Balconies on the West facade of Tower 'C' are proposed to project into the SRW by up to 0.75m into the 10.0m SRW that runs along the side of the property. The clear height below the projecting balconies is proposed to be no less than 5.8m.
- Seeking variance from (40) bicycles to (40) bicycle lockers per room to facilitate the large number of bicycle lockers.
- The project proposes to provide 40 dwelling units (+11% of the total unit count) that are designed to incorporate all of the Basic Universal Housing (BUH) Features as described in Section 4.16 of the Richmond Zoning Bylaw 8500: the project proposes to load the 1.86m2 exemption for each of these dwelling units as described in Subsection 4.6.2
- Maximum 7-storey building height permitted
- Urban Agriculture area on podium requires hose bib, tool storage and work table
- Irrigation automatic system for all planted areas, including extensive green roofs
- PROPSRW registered on title. West side balcony encroachments Min 5.8m above grade and Max 0.5m into SRW
- Tree protection required for City trees west site
- Servicing Agreement required for off-site works and works in PROPSRW
